channel.title: How to Start a Server
channel.description:
[center]Some helpful tools not included within this topic that may help you get your server started may be downloaded [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,403663.0.html]here[/url].
[center][b]Downloading winRar[/b][/center]
To start off, we'll download Winrar. Winrar is a program in which you can use to extract files from .rar format, you may download it [url=http://rarlab.com]here[/url]
[center][b]Downloading and Installing Java[/b][/center]
After you have done so, we will need the latest version of the Java Development Kit found [url=http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp]here[/url]. Once you have selected the latest version of Java Development Kit, there will be a question asking which platform you have, or operating system. After you have chosen your platform, you then need to agree to the terms and services and as the next page loads, click "Download Selected with Sun Download Manager". From then on out, let it install and you'll be okay.
Here are the steps below.
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step1-2.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step1-3.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step1-1.jpg[/img]
[center][b]Getting No-Ip[/b][/center]
Well, if you're going to have your server remain public, you're going to have to get No-Ip. No-Ip is a free service where you can use for websites, or servers.
First, you're going to go [url=http://no-ip.com]here[/url] and register an account at the site. You will then click 'Your No-IP' at the top right corner of the page. Then you need to click the 'Hosts and Redirects' button. After you have done so, it will bring you to a page showing your listed domains that you have added, though if you haven't added any you're going to click 'Add a host'. After you have added your desired domain, you're going to need to download the No-Ip Duc, located if you click the button 'Download' on the main page. Like you have done before when downloading Java, you're going to need to select your operating system and let it download.
Pictures of the steps shown below.
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step1-4.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step1-8.jpg[/img]
Now once you have downloaded No-Ip Duc, run it and it should look like the picture below.
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/ok-5.jpg[/img]
Then all you need to check the box next to the domain you want people to log into, and you're good!
[center][b]Setting up your Environmental Variables[/b][/center]
Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java, without it you would simple get 'The path is not yet specified' so this is an extremely important step. We will firstly open 'My Computer' and click 'View System Information'. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says 'Advanced' and at the bottom, click 'Environmental Variables'. Now what you're going to do, is go to your 'Path' and 'Classpath' variables and edit them.
In your Classpath variable, you're going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be;
[code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code]
Though if a newer version comes out, you would change the 'jdk1.6.0_11' to the newest version.
After you have done the Classpath variable, you're going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it.
[code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;[/code]
The same goes for Path, if you download a newer version of JDK then you're going to change the 'jdk1.6.0_11' to your current version.
[center][b]Downloading a source/base[/b][/center]
We're going to need to have something to start from, so choose one from the download section [url=http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,49.0.html]here[/url]. The base you've downloaded could be anything you want, it's your choice. Now when you had downloaded the Winrar program earlier, this is where you'll be using it. Once you have found the base of your choice, you will need to go into the base file, and once you've done so you need to right click it and click 'extract'. Once it's done extracting, you then are free to roam about your source.
Steps are shown below.
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step2-1.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step2-2.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step2-3.jpg[/img]
[center][b]PortForwarding[/b][/center]
From what I've seen from many of you members is that PortForwarding is the hardest step to comprehend, so I'm going to try :P. As I have an old router I may still attempt showing you how, though if anyone feels they may give me pictures of their router that would be great.
First of all, portforwarding is merely a step to allow people connecting to your computer, but in this case it's for connecting to your server. We will first start off by opening your command prompt or 'cmd' through your startup window and typing 'ipconfig' which will bring up a list of details relating to your computer, but all we really need is your default gateway. You can find your default gateway if you scroll down, so once you have done that, open up your internet browser and type it in. This will then bring up your router page, and you will need to click something like 'Applications and gaming', though mine just says 'Firewall'. After you have clicked this, you need to add a new user defined application. Any name is compatible, as long as you follow the syntax shown below and set the application to 'hosted'.
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step1-9.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step2-4.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq76/Ragescape/step3-1.jpg[/img]
If you feel I need to add more on to the port forwarding section, please ask.
I wish I could have given more pictures on the PortForwarding step, though my router is old and I don't think you would have understanded. If any of you benevolant members would be so kind and give me some pictures I'll be gladly to put them on here, thanks for reading!

item.title: How to Start a Server
item.dc:creator: @birdboy birdboy
item.description:
@birdboy wrote:

Ok so i hope everyone can forgive me i’ve been out of the mopar game for about 4 years so i remembered the basic setup. I got my simple moparscape 3.2 client to host my basic server just fine. However, i’ve been looking at some of the newer 317 sources + clients. I’ve noticed that they all have all this SQL stuff now. I’m not a major database person and i’m still learning programming. are there any tutorials on how those are setup or is it just something i shouldn’t really worry about if i’m just doing basic things.

For example, before I knew that when a new player was saved, there would be a folder with a new text document that would be created that contains their information. I assume this is all handled by the SQL Database now so again I have absolutely no idea what i’m doing or if i’m overcomplicating things. I have very limited experience with SQL so i need all the help i can get.

Read full topic

item.title: How to Start a Server
item.dc:creator: @kamakamakaze kamakamakaze
item.description:
@kamakamakaze wrote:

[quote=“haloboy97, post:6, topic:259517”]When I go to the command prompt and type in ipconfig it just says “‘ipconfig’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.” and I don’t know what to do…[/quote]

If that happens just search cmd in windows search thingy then RIGHT click and run as administrator

Read full topic

item.title: How to Start a Server
item.dc:creator: @Yavapai Yavapai
item.description:
@Yavapai wrote:

This is what i find for 127.0.0.1 but nothing in client.java.

[1] Class26.java (Line 24)
aString354 = Loader.IP;//“127.0.0.1”;

    [2] Class291.java (Line 361)     
        			if (string.endsWith("127.0.0.1") || string.endsWith(Loader.IP))     

    [3] Loader.java (Line 21)     
        	public static String IP = "127.0.0.1";     

    [4] Loader.java (Line 30)     
        	public static String LOBBY_IP = "127.0.0.1";     

    [5] Loader.java (Line 39)     
        				LOBBY_IP = IP = "127.0.0.1";

Read full topic

item.title: How to Start a Server
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Why update it? port forwarding hasn’t changed much since this thread was posted, all you have to do is add an exception to your firewall and then add your port to the router so it will route all packets that use TCP and port 43594 to your computer on the network.

Read full topic

item.title: How to Start a Server
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

I just read through 42 pages of the exact same questions.
“Why does my compiler say java isn’t recognized?”
“Why does cmd say ipconfig is not recognized?”
“Why is my default gateway asking for a username and password?”
I also saw those three question answered on every single page.
If you guys can’t figure out how to read through a thread, avoid the stress of trying to set up a server.
And to limit these same spam questions since I’m so nice, just message me on Skype if you need help.
breebreebran

Read full topic

item.title: How to Start a Server
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“ITI Basak ITI, post:1029, topic:259517”]Your Portforwarding section is where I have been stuck for a very long time. You’re router screen looks exactly like mine does. I portforded exactly like you did and so on. I tried checking it with PfPortchecker and it says the TCP port is open but the UDP port is not open. I have disabled all firewals on my computer for a few minutes in order to check if it was that and it wasnt. I have allowed access through all firewalls aswell. Any idea on how to get the UDP to open up for me? I am hosting a Minecraft server which runs perfectly. I didnt do anything differently

Thanks[/quote]

The server only uses the TCP protocol.

Read full topic

item.title: How to Start a Server
item.dc:creator: @ITI_Basak_ITI ITI Basak ITI
item.description:
@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

Your Portforwarding section is where I have been stuck for a very long time. You’re router screen looks exactly like mine does. I portforded exactly like you did and so on. I tried checking it with PfPortchecker and it says the TCP port is open but the UDP port is not open. I have disabled all firewals on my computer for a few minutes in order to check if it was that and it wasnt. I have allowed access through all firewalls aswell. Any idea on how to get the UDP to open up for me? I am hosting a Minecraft server which runs perfectly. I didnt do anything differently

Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: How to Start a Server
item.dc:creator: @rarffen rarffen
item.description:
@rarffen wrote:

[quote=“I Hawt I, post:1026, topic:259517”][quote author=Dick Salad link=topic=342685.msg3696918#msg3696918 date=1312494176]
i get the same problem as the other guy when i type in ipconfig it says ipconfig is not reconised as a internal or external command, operable program or batch file plz tell me how to fix this
[/quote]

Anyone else who asks this, CMD>RightClick>RunAsAdmin>redo ipconfig[/quote]

Alternate Fix: Go to CMD, type in path, if the path does not contain \system32 at the end, go into your environmental variables, double click “path” and at the end add &systemroot%\system32, apply changes, and then go back to cmd and re-type “ipconfig” should work then.

Read full topic
